a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Death rate from indoor air pollution vs. share in extreme poverty, 2022
Age-standardized death rates from illness attributed to household air pollution from solid cooking fuels,
measured per 100,000 individuals versus the share of the total population living below the International Poverty
Indoor air pollution death rate (deaths per 100,000 people)
Data source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2024); World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2024)
Note: Poverty data is measured in international-$ at 2017 prices to account for inflation and differences in living costs between countries.
Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, per capita.
